result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on January 11, 2023 at 08:30 am.

11:46 AM Defendant Kevin Brian Mitchell appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Christopher M. Eippert appeared by phone for Kevin Brian Mitchell.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Motion to adjourn jury trial filed by Defense, State needed to comply with victims rights as to adjournment. State is in compliance. Defense, request for adjournment of trial based on investigation, would like to continue with further investigation and discovery. State, no objections to request. Deft willing to waive right to speedy trial. Court grants Defense's motion to adjourn Jury Trial.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on December 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

4:06 PM Defendant Kevin Brian Mitchell in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher M. Eippert in court for Kevin Brian Mitchell.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin. 950/Marsy's Law complied with.  Speedy trial set for 11/09/22. Court rcvd' motion by State to admit audio visual statement, also rcvd' DVD earlier Today, hasn't been able to review yet. Rcvd' Defense's motion to adjourn Jury Trial, Defense is still conducting investigation needs more time, withdrawing previous speedy trial demand. Deft hasn't rvd' video yet, requests to address all motions at a later date. Court doesn't take actions on motions Today, leaves trial on calendar, next date to address motion to adjourn trial. Deft waives speedy trial demand at this time, withdraws.

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Eippert is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $100 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 10/01/22.  
 Failure to make payment on the schedule as established above shall result in the remaining balance becoming immediately due. Sheboygan County through its Corporation Counsel, may initiate a lawsuit or other collection action against you to collect the amount due, together with costs.
The attorney shall be compensated at $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court. To receive payment, bill must be submitted within 90 days of withdrawal or case disposition.
Copy provided to DE on 8/24
